page.title: 13Brigham and Mosser Parishes
page.content: The{Rev. P. Barber}runs two parishes with one church in each,{St Philip's at Mosser and{St Bridgets}in Brigham. In winter on Sunday he normally takes 3 services. In summer he takes 4. 40 people normally attend the services. Apart from services he officiates at baptisms, weddings, school services and funerals. On Wednesday morning for 40 minutes at{Paddle School}he teaches us R.E. In his spare time Mr Barber often goes visiting ill people in hospital and old people. St Philip's church, about 100 years old is just up the road from school. As most churches do it faces east and is a rectangular shape. The church has a small font.{St {Philip's}when full up holds a little over 100 people. Our school's harvest festival is held at the church.{St {Bridget's}is a{Norman}church with some very old stained glass windows.
